result.execSummary:
The defendant Parnell D Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Credit For Time Served 39 Days, If Revoked.
Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration AND the Substance Abuse Programs.

miscConds.notes:
Cost and Surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit Random Urine Screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with: the Pick N Save Store listed in the Criminal Complaint or any witnesses.
DNA Sample to be provided, if not yet previously done.
AA and NA meetings once a week.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Parnell D Brown in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Smith.   Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilty plea to the charge. 

  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

 36 months Prison
18 month initial
18 extended supervision -  consecutive

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEARS  

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
*No contact with:  the Pick N Save store listed in the complaint or any witnesses
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
*AA and NA meetings once a week

FINE or COURT COSTS:  $268.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is  eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
59 days credit if revoked.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Motion for bail reduction and/or modification filed by Attorney Smith
Hearing on August 5, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on July 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Parnell D Brown in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Smith.   Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 19, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
